Text.content:
In a real world scenario, you typically are developing a template JSP by starting with a HTML prototype, e.g., provided by a design agency.

It is straight forward to transform such an HTML prototype into a OpenCms template.

As an example, download the CSS file of the Bulma framework and store it under /system/modules/org.opencms.examples.template/resources/css/bulma.min.css.

Include the CSS file in the head section of your template JSP. Use a <cms:link> tag and the %(link.weak:) Macro for this. The macro has the purpose that if you once rename or move the CSS file, OpenCms will automatically adjust the link in the template JSP.

The example below renders a nicely styled notification using some class names from the included CSS.
